organic_template.description: Template for organic polygon generation - copy and modify for use
organic_template.author: Mr. Chuck
organic_template.comments: This is a template (note the word 'template' in the name). Not meant to be run directly. Copy this section and modify parameters for your specific needs.
commands: PROC dynamic_polygon shape1 VERTICES=6,10 BOUNDS=100,100,600,600 ITERATIONS=15 OPERATIONS=sawtooth DIRECTION_BIAS=inward DEPTH_RANGE=0.3,0.8

test_small.description: Small canvas test - good for quick iterations
test_small.author: Mr. Chuck
test_small.comments: Quick test with small bounds. Good for seeing structure clearly.
commands: PROC dynamic_polygon test VERTICES=5 BOUNDS=150,150,350,350 ITERATIONS=8 OPERATIONS=split_offset

organic_inward.description: Organic shape with inward bias - creates compact forms
organic_inward.author: Mr. Chuck
organic_inward.comments: Based on organic_template. Inward bias creates more compact, solid-feeling shapes.
commands: PROC dynamic_polygon shape1 VERTICES=7 BOUNDS=100,100,600,600 ITERATIONS=15 OPERATIONS=sawtooth DIRECTION_BIAS=inward DEPTH_RANGE=0.3,0.8

organic_outward.description: Organic shape with outward bias - creates spiky, radiating forms
organic_outward.author: Mr. Chuck
organic_outward.comments: Based on organic_template but with outward bias. Creates more aggressive, pointed shapes.
commands: PROC dynamic_polygon shape1 VERTICES=7 BOUNDS=100,100,600,600 ITERATIONS=15 OPERATIONS=sawtooth DIRECTION_BIAS=outward DEPTH_RANGE=0.3,0.8

complex_layered.description: Complex layered composition with multiple shapes
complex_layered.author: Mr. Chuck
complex_layered.comments: Creates a background shape and foreground shape with z-ordering. Good test of composition.
commands: PROC dynamic_polygon bg VERTICES=8 BOUNDS=0,0,768,768 ITERATIONS=20 OPERATIONS=split_offset,sawtooth DIRECTION_BIAS=random
PROC dynamic_polygon fg VERTICES=6 BOUNDS=200,200,500,500 ITERATIONS=12 OPERATIONS=sawtooth DIRECTION_BIAS=inward

batch_random_template.description: Template for batch generation with randomization
batch_random_template.author: Mr. Chuck
batch_random_template.comments: Uses RAND() for variation across batch iterations. Perfect for dataset generation.
commands: PROC dynamic_polygon shape VERTICES=RAND(5,8) BOUNDS=100,100,600,600 ITERATIONS=RAND(10,20) OPERATIONS=sawtooth,split_offset DIRECTION_BIAS=random DEPTH_RANGE=RAND(0.2,0.5),RAND(0.6,0.9)
